newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee plunges in kerb after devaluation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee plunges in kerb after devaluation.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee opened 1.95 rupees down at 42.50 to the dollar on Tuesday in the kerb market after the central bank devalued the rupee 7.86 percent against the dollar, dealers said.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan (SBP) moved the rupee to 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar from 36.9700/37.1549. It last changed the rate on September 10.
"The market is very volatile at the moment," dealer Owais Kalia said, adding that the rupee could slide further, but profit-taking in dollars was also expected.
